{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3599887,"name":"Abigail Gonzalez","username":"abigailgonzalez","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-22T14:32:48.435Z","cooked":"

I just became the new software lead, but mostly because all of our programmers graduated. Because of this, I’m pretty nervous about leadership and don’t have many ideas on what to do in this off-season. I want to hear all of your ideas so that we can get to work right away and grow our skills. Also this is my first time on Chief Delphi sorry if the tags are wrong lol

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-22T14:32:48.435Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":335,"readers_count":334,"score":206.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":500140,"topic_slug":"what-are-some-ideas-software-wise-for-this-off-season","display_username":"Abigail Gonzalez","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66901,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3599922,"name":"Ben Kallhoff","username":"99099","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/99099/{size}/250305_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-22T14:49:38.813Z","cooked":"

Similar situation here, I’m trying to focus on teaching younger team members to avoid this situation in the future.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-22T14:49:38.813Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":318,"readers_count":317,"score":87.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":500140,"topic_slug":"what-are-some-ideas-software-wise-for-this-off-season","display_username":"Ben Kallhoff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69031,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I’m here I guess"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3599930,"name":"","username":"Asterbloom","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asterbloom/{size}/249167_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-22T14:51:47.208Z","cooked":"

We were planning on working on things we currently don’t understand very well. A big one for our team is simulation and command based programming, because our team has stuck with timed robot for a while and we want to modernize. Additionally, we will likely be teaching those on our team interested in programming, and we already have a group wanting to learn. I would say this: Learn something that could be useful next year, and help others learn to prepare for years to come.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-22T14:51:47.208Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":311,"readers_count":310,"score":91.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":500140,"topic_slug":"what-are-some-ideas-software-wise-for-this-off-season","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":72232,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1511 Programmer"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3599956,"name":null,"username":"AutumnPlanet","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/autumnplanet/{size}/260647_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-22T15:06:27.997Z","cooked":"

As 9436 software team, this offseason we tried to make robot and vision simulation until the mechanics finished the test chassis. In the robot simulation, we also had a project to align all reefs with a single button, you can reach it from the following topic

Reefscape one-button automatic alignment

Our code is also in this link:
Github

If you have a question you want to ask, you can reach without hesitation.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-22T15:06:27.997Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":277,"readers_count":276,"score":84.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":500140,"topic_slug":"what-are-some-ideas-software-wise-for-this-off-season","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/reefscape-one-button-automatic-alignment/500045","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Reefscape one-button automatic alignment","clicks":17},{"url":"https://github.com/Giro-FRC/AdvantageKitSwerve","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - Giro-FRC/AdvantageKitSwerve: AdvantageKitSwerve in off season","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70504,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3599957,"name":"Eric (319)","username":"EKM_319","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ekm_319/{size}/230932_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-22T15:08:22.438Z","cooked":"

Knowing where and how to find solutions online for software problems.

Where is wpilib docs, what’s in it.

Where are the APIs located. How to navigate them.
Finding out what tools are available to you and how they are used.

Language specific basics ( c++/java/python/kotlin/ etc)

Command based programming basics

  • Particularly factory methods

( really understanding these is also on my list. As i’m used to the older command paradigm)

Logging and visualization if you aren’t using Advantagekit already is a huge help.

How PID Control works is a great thing to teach incoming students as well. Best practices for tuning PID Gains.

All pretty much all of this info can be found on WPILib or specific documentation for products/applications.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-22T15:08:22.438Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":252,"readers_count":251,"score":99.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":500140,"topic_slug":"what-are-some-ideas-software-wise-for-this-off-season","display_username":"Eric (319)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23786,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Awaiting our Robot Overlords since 2013"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3599959,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-22T15:09:18.753Z","cooked":"

One thing that’s under-valued and always worth time investment is fault detection!

There’s a WPILib pull request for a working resistance detection algorithm that’s been stagnant for years for lack of real-world testing…

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-22T15:09:18.753Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":217,"readers_count":216,"score":168.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":500140,"topic_slug":"what-are-some-ideas-software-wise-for-this-off-season","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/wpilibsuite/allwpilib/pull/5500","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"[wpilib] Add class to calculate robot resistance by calcmogul · Pull Request #5500 · wpilibsuite/allwpilib · GitHub","clicks":66}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3599976,"name":"Nolan Barker","username":"therekrab","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/therekrab/{size}/248500_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-22T15:19:27.922Z","cooked":"

This depends heavily on where your team is at. But, I’ll provide my ideas for what I would try to aim for in the off season:

Vision

The importance of vision is clearly growing in FRC. So it’s really important to make sure that you’ve got a vision system that you like. Depending on what your team can do, I’d recommend building a chassis bot with cameras. Although not a perfect match for a comp bot, a robot with wheels and cameras is great for testing vision-related code.
Some goals to aim for:

  • Find a camera configuration that works for you. Before touching the robot, run simulations to find good camera angles and positions.
  • Experiment with different resolutions. This year, we had a lot of success with lower resolutions at higher frame rates.
  • Find a coprocessor (or multiple) that works for you.
  • Try to get the most accurate and fast pose estimations that work for you.

Obviously, the positions of your cameras should be dependent on the placement of the AprilTags on the field. Thus, the camera positions on the bot should not be fixed before the season begins.

Also, work on filtering and processing vision updates such that you:

  1. Don’t throw away good data
  2. Don’t accept bad data

There are a lot of filtering options that you could use and I myself very much want to experiment with as well.
Overall, make yourself (and others on the team if possible) very familiar with how your vision systems work.

Autonomous driving

This year, we did alright with our autonomous functionality, but one of our biggest issues was controlling the robot to quickly align and drive towards locations.
If you have a chassis bot, mess with your autoalign and path following/generating logic to get it to a point where you want it. Regardless of the game, having solid control over the drivetrain during autonomous control is a very good practice.

Control systems

I’d recommend playing around with different control systems on different mechanisms. You may not use them next year, but it would be cool to have experience with more subsystems. Personally, I want to revisit our robot from 2024 and try to improve the functionality of our pivot subsystem. We saw issues with oscillation as well as poor tuning that constantly needed to be adjusted mid-comp.
I’m personally really excited about pushing state-space control for the robot next year for most subsystems, but I’d also make sure you know how to implement a profiled PID controller when you need it.

Look over old code

This is probably more fun if you’re not at robotics for the day and wake up bored. Looking over your old code and making notes about programming practices you wish you implemented, better ways to design a system, etc. is something that I rarely do but wish I did.
Look for places you could have added more future-proofing to your code, and keep these considered when writing code for this year.
Avoid a case like this (which actually happened this year):

Because we wrote code fast and didn’t consider future-proofing our code for further modification, adding a relatively simple feature to our algae code required that I had to rewrite ALL OF OUR ALGAE-RELATED CODE. In between matches. At worlds.

I won’t make that mistake again.

Following good programming practices is a good idea. If you aren’t familiar with design patterns, the off-season is a great time to learn.
Reviewing old code can actually be somewhat fun and can be done anywhere. Sometimes, to have a more hands-on experience, I’ll print out code from a single subsystem or module of our code, and annotate it with a pen or pencil. I find it enjoyable.

Find a style of code that makes modularity simple, and easy to teach.

Logging

For my team at least, I want to setup a logging system using Advantage Scope and get that running on an old comp bot. It feels like it would be helpful in the future.

Simulation… plus other fun features

One thing I’ve seen already mentioned is simulations. I’d highly recommend that you play around with simulation and get it to a point where you’re confident that you can fix most of your bugs early, before you even get a robot.
If you’re not familiar with simulations, read the docs.

This leads into a very important idea for advancing your programming skills:

Please read the docs

I can’t begin to count the number of times that this saved me this year. Instead of stuggling for hours with a goofy problem, a quick lookup to the java API (which should be bookmarked at all times for all vendordeps on all computers).

Prepare new members

This is true for all groups. This is high school robotics, so people move through the program fast. This means that you should be ready to go as soon as a new programmer steps into your space. Be ready to teach them all they need to know. If you have new members in the off season, do your team a favor and educate them on what’s going on. Please don’t leave your team without at least one person who can do your job just as well as (or better than) you can.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-22T16:09:59.562Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":209,"readers_count":208,"score":111.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":500140,"topic_slug":"what-are-some-ideas-software-wise-for-this-off-season","display_username":"Nolan Barker","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65568,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming Lead - 3414 Hackbots"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3600075,"name":"Josh","username":"AegisNova","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aegisnova/{size}/247863_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-22T15:56:39.766Z","cooked":"

Typically, as stated above, vision and logging is something good to invest your time into. Re-program a robot, this year’s, last years, etc. Probably make sure it’s a swerve bot, it’s good for you guys to be able to do a swerve base with ease. Briefly look into codes for wrists, arms, elevators, different sensors, or even level up your automation skills. Another little project that’s dope is LEDs, they look awesome, give your team wiring practice, and are a fun side project.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-22T15:56:39.766Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":152,"readers_count":151,"score":65.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":500140,"topic_slug":"what-are-some-ideas-software-wise-for-this-off-season","display_username":"Josh","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Project Manager / Drive / Everything | 6317"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3600077,"name":"Tyler Veness","username":"calcmogul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-22T15:57:10.768Z","cooked":"

Yep. The original version was PRed in April 2022… it works in sim, so it just needs someone with an actual robot to test it IRL. I assume lack of user interest is why it’s been ignored for 3 years, so I wouldn’t expect anyone to use it even if we do merge it.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-22T16:00:10.900Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":150,"readers_count":149,"score":59.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":500140,"topic_slug":"what-are-some-ideas-software-wise-for-this-off-season","display_username":"Tyler Veness","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3600083,"name":"Eric (319)","username":"EKM_319","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ekm_319/{size}/230932_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-22T15:59:44.464Z","cooked":"
therekrab:

Look over old code

Also, look over other’s code!

Did you see something somebody else was doing that made you wonder how do they do this?

Also i’ve personally found looking at other’s styling or coding standards has been a good way to find what works best for you.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-22T15:59:44.464Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":152,"readers_count":151,"score":45.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":500140,"topic_slug":"what-are-some-ideas-software-wise-for-this-off-season","display_username":"Eric (319)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23786,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Awaiting our Robot Overlords since 2013"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3600096,"name":"Val DiBona","username":"Otter502","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/otter502/{size}/245799_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-22T16:06:42.558Z","cooked":"

We had designed a public auto alignment system. A major thing we are going to do during the offseason is simplify and generalize the code so we can reuse it from year to year!

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-22T16:06:42.558Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":139,"readers_count":138,"score":42.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":500140,"topic_slug":"what-are-some-ideas-software-wise-for-this-off-season","display_username":"Val DiBona","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/4915-pathplanner-auto-align-whitepaper/494669","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"4915 PathPlanner Auto Align Whitepaper","clicks":17}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"username":"therekrab","name":"Nolan Barker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/therekrab/{size}/248500_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63596,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3600814,"name":"Samjackjoetedpaulbill","username":"Big_frc_fan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T01:07:26.351Z","cooked":"

Don’t just use LEDs to add a cool factor though, during play the LEDs should be visible to the driver as much as possible and provide feedback to the drive team about the state of the robot and whatever task it is doing - game piece acquired, april tag acquired, auto align complete, game piece stuck etc. These can be invaluable for reducing cycle times, quickly determining the nature and severity of a problem in match to adjust the game plan - ie is the intake toast or jammed (ie detect voltage spike on intake motors), can we pivot to the other game piece, do we have to play D because we only have a drivetrain now, is the vision system having problems and driver needs to go to manual mode etc.

That too, it’s definitely more of a good thing to get it under your belt and be ready to use it in future years. Personally we added LEDs to last year’s robot to get a grasp on things and it looks awesome too.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T01:59:11.534Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":34.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":500140,"topic_slug":"what-are-some-ideas-software-wise-for-this-off-season","display_username":"Josh","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"username":"Big_frc_fan","name":"Samjackjoetedpaulbill","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/5e9695/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Project Manager / Drive / Everything | 6317"},"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":false},{"id":3601043,"name":"Dan","username":"tekdemo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T06:26:24.442Z","cooked":"

As far as “things to build to be able to help lead the team”, I’d try some of the following.

  • Get competent in simulations + Mechanism2D models, so you and your team can program without hardware
  • Simulate and implement a robot of different design and slightly greater complexity than one your team built last season.
  • Implement your existing robot in different ways (eg, full state machine, command oriented, partial state machines, or just a full re-do if your current code is a disaster)
  • Identify and resolve problems you had last season (auto, state handling, path-planning, vision, feed-forwards, whatever). Or, resolve them in different manners than the one you ended up with.
  • That one really cool thing you saw some other team do? Simulate and implement that.
  • Repeat.

Or, in other words: Find where your limits currently are, and push. Don’t worry about doing things perfectly, just pick a thing, work at it until you’re satisfied with the result, then go do another thing.

The goal here is to just diversify your experience, but without getting too far away from the problems you’re likely to face next year given the constraints and capabilities of your program. This will help you understand where folks might be struggling when they need help, and steer them towards solutions that might be better.

Once you have folks up and running, then is the time to have folks really dig into crunchier topics, and “level up” your program with new technical expertise.

For a leadership role practice, I’d also suggest finding some local workshop or educational event, and help out. When I’ve seen when students step into a leadership, one of the tricky points is often figuring out how to answer questions, and identify where folks struggle. Those beginner “learn to X” workshops are a great way to see folks struggle on “trivial” things, and give you a number of opportunities to figure out how to identify what their issue is and get them moving past it without doing it for them. Plus, this is a lot of fun, and you’ll meet some great people doing it.
